channel.title: Tutorials on LightJason
channel.description: Recent content in Tutorials on LightJason

item.title: Tutorial: Actions
item.description: This tutorial explains the concept and usage of actions. Actions are executable mechanisms. We support a lot of different actions which support some basic functionality.

item.title: Tutorial: Communication
item.description: LightJason architecture does not support in general a built-in communication, because communication and agent addressing / naming depends on the domain or underlying software architecture.

item.title: Tutorial: Develop an AgentSpeak Scenario in 15 Minutes
item.description: This tutorial explains how to develop a simple, but fully working scenario in 15 minutes with the most recent version of the AgentSpeak(L++) source code.

item.title: Tutorial: Environment
item.description: The LightJason system architecture does not require any environment, but you can easily write your own.

item.title: Tutorial: How to Build AgentSpeak from Source
item.description: This tutorial explains how to build LightJason/AgentSpeak(L++) from source.

item.title: Tutorial: Trigger
item.description: This tutorial explains the functionality of agent triggering. For understanding the purpose of triggers you have to understand the concept of events, which is a well-known concept in UI programming.

item.title: Tutorials
item.description: In this section, we introduce LightJason/AgentSpeak(L++) from a hands-on perspective by providing tutorials for understanding the practical applications of our framework.

item.title: Wizard
item.description: The wizard allows you to create a full working package of a multi-agent simulation. You get a zip file which contains a full working Maven project.
